Drug Quality and Safety 
We understand that our products’ reliability, safety, 
and quality are critical for keeping our patients safe. 
We are committed to scientific integrity, operational 
excellence, and regulatory compliance in developing, 
producing, and delivering innovative, high-quality 
therapeutics to those we serve. Our Quality Manual 
and Quality Policy guide our processes and are 
designed to ensure we apply our values across the 
product lifecycle to manufacture safe, reliable, and 
effective products for our patients.We conduct a Biannual Executive Quality Review to inform 
executives about patient-centric drug manufacturing by highlighting 
relevant performance indicators. We also produce a Quality Review 
Report that includes a quarterly management review of quality-
related objectives and metrics. Our commitment to the quality and safety of our 
products is proven by our performance. In 2021, Seagen 
had zero product recalls and received no warning letters 
or critical findings from health authorities.
The manufacturing of all of our clinical and commercial products is 
designed to comply with current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) 
and meet global quality standards as defined by the U.S. FDA, the 
International Council for Harmonisation (ICH) of Technical 
Requirements for Pharmaceuticals for Human Use, and Eudralex 
Volume 4. We utilize a Quality Management System (QMS) designed to 
maintain compliance with regulations and regulatory requirements and 
ensure our products meet all expectations for safety, identity, strength, 
purity, and quality. The quality oversight of our suppliers is maintained 
through our risk-based auditing program and cross-functional vendor 
management teams.
Our culture of quality is supported by the active engagement of all 
individuals across the organization, including our leaders, to drive 
quality-focused behaviors, robust decision-making, and continuous 
improvement based on the needs of our patients and customers.
